      • computeValuesWithSmallerHammingWeight

        public static ByteArray[] computeValuesWithSmallerHammingWeight(int maxWeight,
                                                int numBits)
        Computes efficiently all values with "numBits" bit length, with a hamming weight less or equal to "maxweight". Efficiently means the following: Assume, numBits = 1024, and maxWeight = 3. First, the algorithm computes all, 1024 in total, representations for values with 1 bit set, such as ...001, ...010, ...100 etc. Second, the algorithm computes all, (1023 * 1023) / 2 in total, representations for values with 2 bits set, such as ..0011, ..0101, ..1001 etc. Third, the algorithm computes all, (1022 * 1022 * 1022) / 2 in total, representations for values with 3 bits set, such as .00111, .01011, .10011 etc. These values are returned.
        Parameters:
        maxWeight - The maximium hamming weight.
        numBits - The number of bits in the value.
        Returns:
        An array with these values. As one value can have many bits (they are each "numBits" long), each value is represented by a byte array. Note, that the MSB is the MSB of the first byte, the LSB is the LSB in the last byte.

      • getHammingWeightForValue

        public static int getHammingWeightForValue(int value)
        Computes the hamming weight of the given value.

      • getHammingWeightForValue

        public static int getHammingWeightForValue(long value)

      • getHammingWeightForValue

        public static int getHammingWeightForValue(long value,
                           int numBytes)
        Computes the hamming weight of the least significant numBytes bytes of the given value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value.
        numBytes - Indicates how many bytes shall be included.

      • getHammingWeightForValue

        public static int getHammingWeightForValue(ByteArray value)
        Calls getHammingWeightForValue(int) with parameters value and the length of the given ByteArray.

      • getHammingWeightForValue

        public static int getHammingWeightForValue(ByteArray value,
                           int numBytes)
        Computes the sum of the hamming weights of the first numBytes bytes in the given array.
        Parameters:
        value - The array.
        numBytes - Indicates how many bytes shall be included.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the length of value is smaller or equal to numBytes.

      • hasHigherHammingWeightThan

        public static boolean hasHigherHammingWeightThan(long value,
                                 int maxWeight,
                                 int numBytes)
        Returns true if the first numBytes bytes in the given value have a hamming weight which is smaller or equal to maxWeight. Returns false otherwise.

      • hasHigherHammingWeightThan

        public static boolean hasHigherHammingWeightThan(ByteArray value,
                                 int maxWeight,
                                 int numBytes)
        Returns true if the first N bytes in the given value have a hamming weight which is smaller or equal to maxWeight. Returns false otherwise.
